name: Utility
description: System utilities and maintenance tools for development and system management

commands.name: System Information
commands.description: Displays detailed system information including hardware specifications, memory, storage, and system version. Useful for troubleshooting and system documentation.

commands.name: Disk Usage
commands.description: Shows disk space usage in human-readable format. Displays total, used, and available space for all mounted filesystems.

commands.name: Memory Usage
commands.description: Displays current memory usage and system load. Shows CPU usage, memory statistics, and top processes by resource consumption.

commands.name: Process List
commands.description: Lists running processes with detailed information including CPU, memory usage, and command details. Useful for monitoring system activity.

commands.name: Kill Process
commands.description: Forcefully terminates a process by its PID. Use with caution as this can cause data loss if the process is writing files.

commands.name: Network Status
commands.description: Shows network interface status and IP addresses. Displays active network connections and their configurations.

commands.name: Ping Test
commands.description: Tests network connectivity to a specified host. Shows response times and packet loss statistics for network troubleshooting.

commands.name: Port Scan
commands.description: Scans specified ports on a host to check which services are running. Useful for security auditing and service discovery.

commands.name: Find Files
commands.description: Searches for files matching a pattern in the current directory and subdirectories. Supports wildcards and file type filtering.

commands.name: Search in Files
commands.description: Searches for text patterns in files recursively. Useful for finding specific code, functions, or text across a codebase.

commands.name: File Size
commands.description: Shows file size and details in human-readable format. Displays permissions, owner, size, and modification date.

commands.name: Compress File
commands.description: Creates a compressed archive of files or directories. Uses gzip compression to reduce file size for storage or transfer.

commands.name: Extract Archive
commands.description: Extracts files from a compressed archive. Supports various archive formats including tar.gz, zip, and rar files.

commands.name: Sync Files
commands.description: Synchronizes files between directories efficiently. Only copies changed files and preserves permissions and timestamps.

commands.name: Backup Directory
commands.description: Creates a complete backup copy of a directory. Preserves all files, subdirectories, and permissions.

commands.name: Clean Temp Files
commands.description: Removes temporary files from the system temp directory. Frees up disk space and cleans system cache files.

commands.name: Monitor Logs
commands.description: Monitors log files in real-time. Shows new log entries as they are written, useful for debugging and system monitoring.

commands.name: System Uptime
commands.description: Shows system uptime and load averages. Displays how long the system has been running and current system load.

commands.name: CPU Information
commands.description: Displays detailed CPU information including model, cores, and specifications. Useful for system diagnostics and performance analysis.

commands.name: Battery Status
commands.description: Shows battery status and health information. Displays charge level, time remaining, and battery condition.

commands.name: WiFi Information
commands.description: Displays WiFi network information including IP address, subnet mask, router address, and DNS servers.

commands.name: Bluetooth Status
commands.description: Shows Bluetooth device information and connection status. Lists paired devices and their current state.

commands.name: Audio Devices
commands.description: Lists audio input and output devices. Shows device names, capabilities, and current status.

commands.name: USB Devices
commands.description: Lists all connected USB devices. Shows device names, manufacturers, and connection status.

commands.name: Firewall Status
commands.description: Shows firewall status and rules. Displays active firewall configuration and security settings.

commands.name: Flush DNS Cache
commands.description: Clears the DNS cache to resolve network connectivity issues. Forces the system to fetch fresh DNS records.

commands.name: Repair Permissions
commands.description: Repairs file permissions for a directory. Fixes ownership issues that can cause permission errors.

commands.name: Repair Disk
commands.description: Verifies disk integrity and repairs filesystem errors. Checks for corruption and attempts to fix issues.

commands.name: Reset Launchpad
commands.command: defaults write com.apple.dock ResetLaunchPad -bool true && killall Dock
commands.description: Resets the Launchpad to default settings. Clears app organization and returns to factory layout.

commands.name: Clear System Cache
commands.description: Clears system and user caches to free up disk space and resolve performance issues.

commands.name: Check for Updates
commands.description: Checks for available system software updates. Lists pending updates that can be installed.

commands.name: Install Updates
commands.description: Installs all available system software updates. Requires administrator privileges and may require restart.

commands.name: Restart Services
commands.command: sudo launchctl unload /System/Library/LaunchDaemons/[service-name].plist && sudo launchctl load /System/Library/LaunchDaemons/[service-name].plist
commands.description: Restarts a system service by unloading and reloading its launch daemon. Useful for troubleshooting service issues.

commands.name: Monitor Activity
commands.description: Opens real-time system activity monitor. Shows CPU usage, memory consumption, and process details in an interactive interface.

commands.name: Network Speed Test
commands.description: Tests network download speed by downloading a test file. Measures bandwidth and connection performance.

commands.name: Check Open Ports
commands.description: Lists all open network ports and the processes using them. Useful for identifying which services are running.

commands.name: View System Log
commands.description: Shows system log entries from the last hour. Displays kernel messages and system events for troubleshooting.

commands.name: List User Accounts
commands.description: Lists all user accounts on the system. Shows usernames and account information.

commands.name: Detailed Disk Space
commands.description: Shows disk usage for all items in current directory, sorted by size. Helps identify large files and directories.
